column4: hi everybody... i'm trying to download chromium OS' source code to compile... I'm getting an error... http://paste.ubuntu.com/459652
has anyone here tried to compile chromium os?
why compile there are debs out and you can also add the repository (google it) thats how i installed it on mine
thanks for the tip. I was trying to get my hands dirty and compile this thing
sometimes why bother.. take the path or least resistance
i learned it with a simple google search
I understand your position. It is the easiest one.

About chromium os... I discovered that their servers are having problems. It is not my fault that I can't execute the command "gclient sync" to get chromium os' source code. Apparently other people tried to sync and are having the same problem
I want to compile to get the bleeding edge latest... When were your chromium os' debs created?
let me check cause after i installed it it will update
you wanna try a deb or repository?
which one has the latest?
using lucid?
ok once yo do as this site says it will update in the update manager
http://www.ubuntugeek.com/how-to-install-chromium-google-chrome-in-ubuntu-using-deb-package.html
just follow the steps
the link you posted is for chromium browser... i am trying to compile chromium OS
yep...
well then.. hmm what about #linux?
I'll wait until tomorrow.. maybe it is going to fixed by then
sorry i could not help
hey... thanks for the effort
no prob, bob
